document_data.caption: A celestial unicorn.
document_data.name: Celestial Charger
document_data.refs3e: <ref group="note">The source describes a celestial charger simply as a [[unicorn]] with the [[celestial creature]] template. The challenge rating provided here is for the weakest possible celestial charger, not the advanced-hit-die [[cleric]] provided as an example.
document_data.mainbody:
A '''celestial charger''' was a breed of [[Celestial creature|celestial]] [[unicorn]] from the [[Mount Celestia|Seven Mounting Heavens of Celestia]] or the [[Grove of the Unicorns]], the [[divine realm]] of [[Mielikki]].

{{Quote|When all else fails, its light remains.|Anonymous.{{Cite MTG|AFR|005|Celestial Unicorn|[[Johannes Voss]]}}}}
document_data.Personality:
Celestial chargers were champions for the cause of good and powerful defenders of peaceful forests and those who inhabited them.

It was common for celestial chargers to become [[cleric]]s, using [[divine magic]] to support their noble causes.
document_data.Abilities:
Besides the innate magical powers shared with common unicorns, celestial chargers were resistant to harm from [[acid]], [[cold]], [[electricity]], and [[spell]]s. The most powerful among them were also resilient against attacks from mundane weapons.

Like all celestial creatures, an attack from one against an evil foe could sometimes cause more increased harm than the same blow would inflict on a non-evil creature.
document_data.Notable Celestial Chargers: The [[tome archon]] [[Raziel]] rode a celestial charger into battle named Temperion.
